filteredArticles.headline: Penn Med study shows financial incentive can help physicians receive opioid training
filteredArticles.abstract: After receiving the training, the study found that 65% of physicians reported administering or prescribing the treatment within five months.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn study finds political beliefs affected how Americans followed distancing guidelines

Penn study finds that speech can transmit viruses

dominantMedia.title: Penn Medicine.jpg
dominantMedia.content: A Penn Medicine study found that financial incentive would encourage 89% of physicians to get proper training to administer buprenorphine.

filteredArticles.headline: Former dean of Penn School of Veterinary Medicine Barry Stupine dies at 78
filteredArticles.abstract: Stupine worked as an Associate Dean and then Vice Dean for Administration and Finance at Penn Vet from 1978 to 2009. He also held interim positions at the School of Dental Medicine and Office of Budget and Resources at Penn.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Emeritus Penn Trustee and philanthropist Madlyn Abramson dies at 84

Penn Vet begins research to see if dogs can detect coronavirus

dominantMedia.title: Barry Stupine Penn Vet.JPG
dominantMedia.content: Barry Stupine was the former leader of the School of Veterinary Medicine and Ryan Veterinary Hospital. (Photo from the Stupine Family)
